column1: Yeah about 10 years ago I had a horrifying experience. It was 100% their fault but they hit the water barrels and survived. They had no injuries but they almost ran me off the road.
No I wasn't hit. It turned out they were drunk. I felt guilty but realized it was his fault.
I don't know I was new to driving and hadn't experienced anything like that. I felt like my horn made him swerve into the water barrels.
Well, can you tell me about your experience? I think we swapped places
Oh my goodness, that's very scary! I hope you are okay now and the drunk driver was punished for his actions?
I there, dont know what to do, jst broke up with my girlfirned, we were 8 years together
Yes we decided together with our minds, and know i come home and feel so distant from the world
I couldn't wait to go to the concert.
The U2 concert. Tickets were really expensive and I never thought we would be able to go, but somehow we did!!!
I'm so sad because i've read an article about a newborn girl who died because her parents didn't believe in medication and doctors
she was born premature at home, she had hard time breathing on her own but instead of taking her to the doctor parents were just praying
yes! And i do believe in God and prayers but goodness gracious please take your children to the hospital and let God heal them THROUGH doctors
so my friend's baby fell down and scraped his knee yesterday and i was trying so hard to cheer him up
i was singing nursery songs
If you happy and you know it
my husband lost a job but i'm hoping he can find a full time job soon
thank you so much!
he is an armed guard
i just moved to this neighborhood and some dumb criminals shot one of my neighbors and ran into the woods!
I do! I want to be able to protect my son
i'm so excited because i'm finally going to visit my parents next month! I didn't see them for 3 years
I moved to the US and they stayed in my homecountry
I was very angry when a co worker lied about a car accident to get out of working July 4th. I covered his shift till midnight and he was lying about the accident
Yeah he got caught in someones pics on Facebook. Never lie and then go out with people who like to take pictures.
Good idea. i don't like social media that much. It can get you in to trouble fast, even when expressing your opinions.
So yeah i drove 2 hours to get to wallmart. with 299 in my wallet as advertised, and the real price of the tv was 399 usd. what a bummer
Yeah i had my hopes reall high and then i left empty handed, such a terrible feeling!
Yes, i guess walmart and the rest of false advertisement in the US, the look in my daugther eyes when i came home empty handed
My friend's boyfriend recently made a pass at me. I'm married, and I also am really good friend's with his girlfriend so I felt really bad. I made sure he knew I was loyal and honest to both!

I struggled with it, but my friend was in a really bad spot, with no income and raising her grandchild, he was the financial supporter. So, I didn't tell her, as I knew it would really hurt her in several ways, plus she really loves him!
my baby is sleeping. it's so peaceful and quiet in this house
i totally agree with you!
hi, i feel so lonely sometimes because all my friends live in a different country
i was thinking about it! I wanted to join a group for local moms

I have a friend that has a child that is unruly and does bad things. One day at our home, he grabbed a game and sat on it, instantly breaking it! It was expensive and this really irked me, especially because she doesn't discipline him when he does bad things.
Me either! I have two of my own children, and I would have never let them get away with that kind of behavior when they were his age. I just don't understand those kind of parents!
I'm so scared of bugs! i found one in my hair yesterday and almost died
Ugh I hate bugs with a passion, they are so creepy
I recently spoke with my ex-girlfriend on the phone. The conversation went pretty well, and it reminded me of my past experiences with her.
Yes, they ended somewhat well, but there were tense moments. I am glad she's doing well, but I miss her.
Thank you! That means a lot.
One of the times I remember feeling the most blissed out in life was right after the birth of my first child.
Obviously there are the demands of a new child -- but that feeling of finally meeting someone you waited so long for, and the love surrounding the whole situation. Truly something to remember.
Have you ever been in a situation when payment of some kind has come through *just* in the nick of time?! Talk about gratitude!
Absolutely. You go from scared and desperate to grateful and optimistic in one quick moment! It's not a situation I wish to be in again.
Im so grateful for my family due to an incident with my friend
My friend lost her parents and siblings in a fire and their family was very close to mine. So seeing her go through the grief made me realize how thankful I should be
Yes definitely. Never take anything for granted as you never know when it will be taken away from you
I'm a big believer in listening to your gut. Sometimes I might wonder where my intuition is leading me, but it always seems to be spot on.
It is a "knowing" -- and a flowing! When something is right, it just feels easier to go with it -- like you're being led, even if you might not fully know to where.
I couldnt celebrate my 18th birthday as I had exams during the time and I felt terrible for it. But my friends threw a surprise party for me and it was the best!

I was studying in my bedroom for a couple of hours straight with headphones on and then my mom called me to the living room for dinner and when I went out the whole place was decorated and everyone was there
I feel lonely sometimes cause I live in a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and sometimes they are all hanging out with their significant others and I feel lonely
Sometimes they joke about it and obviously I make it look like its totally fine cause I dont want to give them the impression that I am lonely but it does hurt sometimes
As silly as it sounds, I was so surprised at how different my two kids were as babies. You're reminded that they're wired with their own personalities from the git-go.
One was pacifier, one was fingers. One wanted to co-sleep, one liked her space. One liked facing *out* in the Baby Bjorn carrier, one liked cocooning in a sling!
The other day I had a deep craving for Chik-Fil-A.
Mine too. So I drive there and pull in the parking lot and it's completely empty. I then realized it was Sunday.
I visited an orphan once and it was such a surreal moment. It made me realise how thankful I should be for a family
Yes it definitely was. I went with intentions to teach the kid a few things but I ended up learning lots more from him
My oldest and my husband have always had a rough relationship. I've got to believe that as she gets older, it will get better!
That's always good to hear. But in the moment -- argh, my *heart*. How did your mom maneuver the differences between y'all? Did that wear on her?
But in the meantime -- the unspoken strain is NOT fun. But I'm glad to hear about a happy ending -- thank you for that!
I can still look back with shame at the way I treated a girl in sixth grade. I wasn't as bad as others, but that doesn't make me feel any better.
Well, like a lot of 6th graders I was aware of *not* wanting to be an outcast for any reason. And unfortunately, she was. As an adult of course, my heart squeezes for *all* the kids we were!
Unfortunately, she died. I only found out when Facebook first came out, and her brother and I "friended" one another.
I'm currently working for someone that is *such* a great example of a leader! It makes going into work inspiring every day / every way.

That's a very kind statement, and certainly what I would strive for. And it's the rarity that *inspires* me. That should be the norm, not the exception! THAT'S what I'd like to inspire in people. How about you?
That is soul-sapping. What do you do to inspire yourself, and not let that kind of behavior drag you down?
My friend's baby has grown so much since the last time I had seen her!
It had been about 8 weeks - I don't get out her way often, even though we live 30 minutes away.
Yes!  I got to be 'auntie' for a bit and help change her and get her fed and down for a nap while my friend had a chance to toss laundry in the wash.  It was a good day for everyone!
Running my first (and maybe only!) marathon felt like *such* a huge accomplishment!
Ah, it was the best! Plus it helped that I purposely chose an amazing destination in which to run it -- it was the Venice Marathon!
We were living overseas at the times -- the most impressive part was crossing the Grand Canal over a pontoon of boats to finish the marathon ;-)
I recently found out that a person I very much intimately admired did not feel the same way for me. I was pretty surprised.
She just started treating me differently all of a sudden. And now she is going to be moving away soon.
I'm always appalled when I see bullying in action -- whether it's on a playground or political stage -- not much makes me angrier.
How do you channel the anger? Obviously, it too easily turns into the same kind of negative emotion I'm upset about -- so that can feel hypocritical!
Are you ever tempted to put anyone's face on the punching bag?! Ha! (Kidding/not kidding!)

One morning my mother came to my house to pick my daughter up for school and told me she saw my daughter's cat on the road and he had been hit. I had to tell my daughter about the loss of her beloved pet.
She was around 11, so she took it very hard. I went ahead and let her stay home from school, as I knew she wouldn't do well that day.
I was soooo excited to take our kids to Disneyland for the first time!
Same! I was excited because I grew up going there. My grandparents lived in Tucson, and we would spend the summers with them -- the most exciting part being our drive to Disneyland each year!
California! Old school ;-) They've kept so much of the original, while adding lots of new attractions.
I recently spoke to my father for the first time in years. It reminded me of my childhood and the distant past.
We spoke about our recent lives. Apparently he is in the market for a new car.
Do you like to organize your house.  My mother-in-law recently surprised me recently with some organizing stuff b/c she knows how much I love it!
Labels and Bins can be your best friend!  Especially with a new baby.
I find it odd -- and annoying -- when people don't respond to or even acknowledge emails.

It would be great if there was a way we could all tell the best way to reach someone -- I know some people prefer texts to emails -- but if you're in a work situation, how do you ensure communication?
I recently had a big argument with my sister. We both got very upset and angry at each other.
I'm not so sure. We just had a discussion that heated and became an argument with tempers flying.
I felt most lonely when we first moved overseas, my husband then had to travel out of *that* country for business -- AND I had a new baby!
From Santa Fe to Hong Kong -- ultimately a fantastic adventure. And I ended up with a wonderful group of friends. Expats bond quickly!
One of the saddest things to me is when people underestimate what they can do and/or are capable of.
That's perfectly natural. You sound like the kind of person, though, that quickly regained their bearings. Disappointments like that usually come with some *good* lessons.
Once my husband asked me not to tell my mom that he was busy that day when she needed his help but I told her anyway.  I really felt bad b/c he got pretty upset with me.
Yeah thats a good question.  I totally deserved him being mad.  I just felt bad for him b/c he was so busy that day and I didn't want him to have one more thing on his plate I guess
There was a back neighbor that called my 10 year old son a ugly name one time, simply because he entered her yard slightly when he rode around the corner.!
Yes, she lived several house back and she didn't know me, until after she did that! She knew me then, but after I talked to her, she apologized to both of us.
Too often, it's a health scare that makes us value health. It inspires me to try and do something to keep healthy every day.

Happily, I don't have one! It's more seeing family and friends and the situations they're in. Not everything can be helped -- but there are some things we can all do to take care of ourselves, you know?
Every time I look through older photos of my children, I'm taken right back to the time they were that size, and what we were doing! It's a bittersweet feeling, for sure.
Are your kids adults now?
I have an 18 year old as well -- I don't know about you, but it's hard to consider her an adult sometimes!
I have a hard time having confidence in myself but when I got married and I had my hair and makeup done I felt like I was beautiful!  I had so much confidence in myself that day and it was great!
I really try but it's hard to replicate that day for sure.
My husband and I both work for ourselves -- a blessing and a curse at times, since it can be tough to determine a "regular" income.
We found a pretty good balance in that I have a part-time job that I *love* -- and that comes with benefits like insurance. That's a big worry addressed, right there.
I am sorry, because I absolutely know that concern. I truly hope you find a resolution to that.
I met up with an old flame recently, didn't go how I expected
Well, right after she gave me a big hug, she introduced me to her new boyfriend.
I know right! No warning or anything. He turned out to be a nice guy, but I thought it was a little misleading on her part.
My family and I are going on vacation in a few weeks. We rented a largo beachfront condo and I can't wait!
We are going to be staying at Miramar Beach in Florida, about an  hour Panama City Beach. The view is amazing from our balcony and we are so ready!
I was supposed to go for brunch with my friend Maria the other day. At least that was the plan.
Well, we had initially agreed to meet at 11. Wouldn't you know it, she didn't end up returning my text until 3PM!
Me and my mom were at this grocery store recently and this guy started following us outside the store and then again inside the store it was so scary!
Well I knew he was following us and so I asked the manager to walk us out to the car and when he did we saw the guy come out again from between the two buildings b/c he was waiting on us.  so scary!
Did I tell you what happened with Li the other night? Boy do I feel dumb.

She's 45 minutes late to our anniversary dinner. I don't know what happened to me but I called and left an angry message. Turns out, she had gotten T-boned at an intersection and was talking to the Police Officer when I called!
Ugh! I looked like such a fool at my girlfriend's work party!

Well, I ended up having way too much to drink. One of her co-workers had a bottle of Fireball (gross I KNOW) and was making everybody do shots. I didn't want to look foolish, so I had... well too many.
Did I tell you what happened with the concert I was supposed to go to Saturday?
Well first of all, it wasn't just any concert - it was Jay-Z and Beyonce! AND IT GOT RAINED OUT!
You are never going to guess who was sleeping on the couch when I got home from New York...
My friend Benny! The one we all thought died in a monsoon in Thailand!
Recently, my husband came home from grocery shopping and had gifts for me for Mother's Day. He had a beautiful diamond ring and other lovely gifts, it was very unexpected!
I did! I also gave him unexpected gifts and he was super happy. I was very touched by him being so thoughtful!
I know I shouldn't count my chicks before they hatch, but I'm feeling pretty good after that interview today!
This advertising company! The owner was there - you should have seen his face. My last freelance project was a real winner. Think I got it?
Did I ever tell you about the time I "got taken hostage"?

As a heart attack. It was me and Big C at the World's Largest Pistachio. All of the sudden we hear gunshots, and DiDi's still in the car. We ran in the building, and he comes flying in after us. He never pointed the gun at us, and we ended up running away when he was distracted. It's too crazy - I can't make this up. Just glad to be alive!
I went to visit a friend one day and her boyfriend made a pass at me. He actually suddenly kissed me, as I was waiting for my friend to return. I couldn't believe his nerve!
I quietly pushed him away, as I didn't want my friend to hear. I was so shocked and upset, since he knew I wouldn't want to make a scene and took advantage.

This past Friday night our refrigerator stopped cooling! We had to go the weekend without it, and of course had to deal with some unpleasant smells and throw away a large amount of food! It wasn't a fun weekend for us!
Yes, and of course we tried to call and have someone come out, but to no avail! You don't realize how much you rely on things like that until they aren't working!
I felt pretty bad when I was having girl talk with my friend and we were talking about our partners. Her boyfriend had made a pass at me, but I never told her about it.

I felt bad, but she wasn't working and taking care of her grandchild, and her boyfriend was the financial support. I knew it would really be hard on her if she found out, not to mention she really loves him.
I was at the mall and hug my mom and said to her: Time to go Mommy! and i wasnt her, can you imagine my reaction to it?
Yes, totally but at the moment i felt like the stupidiest person on earth, didn't know were to hide! and my mom was watching
THe good thing about it, was the lady, she was laughing and later told me that it has happened to her childrens to, no worries!
I am looking forward to going on vacation in a few weeks! We have a condo reserved on the beach, with fantastic ocean views. I'm ready!
Well, we are staying at Panama City Beach, so we're right there at the Gulf of Mexico.
I am definitely a proud parent of our 15 year old -- she was determined to work this summer, and even with us saying no one would hire her until 16 -- she found a job!
That, and she's enjoying the independence of having her own money. Remember that? Making money that you truly could use for your *pleasure* (and not just necessities?! ;-))
Same! I was surprised 15 year olds *can* actually work during the summer. It's just finding an employer who knows those hours get cut WAY back once school starts.
Okay, a silly pet peeve but one nonetheless -- when people just leave their grocery carts willy-nilly in the parking lot. No consideration for others or the people who work at the store!
Me too. And I will always make sure to at *least* put it in one of those cart corrals, if not walk it back up to the store. Hey -- extra exercise ;-)
WE CAN SAVE THE WOOOOOOORLD!!!!! (lol indeed....!)
I came home, and my wife showed me a picture in 4d of our future baby, my heart speeded so fast!
We choose to wait! but the amount of happiness in my body is tremendous! never felt this way before.
Yes, God willing the baby is going to be healthy in every way! can wait to ave the second
I love being in the "flow" -- whether it's in speaking to a group of people or working to help facilitate meetings.

I work with different organizations on strengthening their culture, and I do large-scale visual notetaking (also known as graphic recording). Are you familiar with that at all? (Not unusual NOT to be!)
That's one of the huge benefits -- learning about many different industries and subjects!
I LOVE when leaders know that it actually *helps* them to be surrounded by strong people -- people they can learn from, that challenge them, and that in some ways could be considered "better".
It's just too many leaders want "yes men" and/or people who feel non-threatening. It's a trap and a quick path to mediocrity, if not failure!
I'll always remember the day I learned I was pregnant with our first child -- Halloween in Chicago, and we were with friends at the Shedd Aquarium! I've loved baby belugas since ;-)
Ha! True that ;-) That's also the year that A Bug's Life came out, and we always thought of our young one as "Dot", the spunky little girl ant in the movie.
This mother's day was amazing! I got so much more than expected and it was all so heartfelt
Yes, definitely! I actually cried a few times because of how much thought went into each gift and what was written in the cards
THat's too bad. What do you think went wrong?
Did they give you any feedback?
That is a shame, you need to learn from your mistakes.
So my sister told us a couple weeks ago she was pregnant. Her and her husband are so excited. I hope they have an amazing 9 months and then an amazing time raising the baby.
I was very surprised. She didn't tell a single person they were trying for a baby. Just announced it on the 4th of July
Yes, they put a picture of their sonogram on the tv and waited for someone to notice it. So exciting
Oh no, what did you do instead? Did you watch Netflix?
Yes, I do. I recently watched the series "Dark." It's the German one.
It's a supernatural mystery type. I won't spoil the twist.
It was fantastic, a lot of people have been comparing it to Stranger Things, but its a lot more grime and serious.

I went to a court hearing for unemployment with my former employer, and I felt great about it since I was so prepared with all of the documents and everything I needed to show the court I was in the right for quitting.
Yes, I actually ended up winning it and they gave me 6 months of unemployment pay.
Yes I am currently working as a processing assistant at a warehouse. I love it. Much better than my last job
Today traffic was horrible and was so frustrating!
Yes! People were constantly cutting me off,not signalling and slamming on their brakes
The grudge scared me when I was 10 to which I couldn't navigate my own house.
And yet I still felt as if I had to see the sequels when they came out too.
My best friend did amazing in school, despite having 2 children and not doing great academically in school. She ended up getting honors in her first 2 semesters.
She has been my friend for 19 years. She pushes me to do better too.
I hope you find someone like that. I believe everyone needs and deserves friends like that.
Today when I went outside to check my new banana plant I noticed the new leaf was turning brown.
I don't think that's the problem. I am worried about a drainage issue. I'm going to check back in a couple days.
I'm new to growing bananas and from what I understand they can be very sensitive to over-watering. It was doing great before today. Possibly wind too.
I decided a few months I was ready for a puppy, so I put the word out
Basically, yes. I made a classified ad. I was beyond thrilled after getting a call to get one!

When I bought my first house I put down 20% of the loan, which made me broke quick. My monthly paycheck helped me with bills but my parents bought me groceries for a month until I got on my feet. SO grateful for them
Yes, I am always better off with them as my parents, they want to see us succeed
Yes, it was well worth it! I love being independant. teaches you a lot.
Maybe 5 more years then I am ready for something bigger. Probably when I get married
My friend is a surgeon and we were discussing salary. He easily makes 200,000 a year and he is only 32. It's crazy and I was jealous of him.
Yeah, that's a good point. I also realized he has a high malpractice insurance, and is on call a lot.
True. He went to college for 12 years! The student loans are probably high too.
I am in college and I was talking to my student adviser the other day about the future
I want to be one to run the office part of a physicians practice but that isn't set in stone. I am thrilled to start my new career path
That is disgusting! What can you do about about it?
You could chat to them and complain!
Who knows, I guess it depends on how reasonable they are.
One time when I was kicked out of the place I was staying at, my best friend immediately told me I could stay with her until I got on my feet.
I stayed with her for about a year until I got my own apartment. We are getting an apartment together in a few months.
She also has 2 daughters, 2 and 7, and a few crested geckos too so I'll have a bunch of roommates.
I've known them since the moment they were born, but it will still be a blast.
Last week when Toys R Us closed it really made me start thinking of the 90s and my childhood
I did! I was talking to my husband about the different toys I had. Even started talking about the music and shows from that era
The other day I came across a Facebook post showing all the old stuff from the 90's.. it took me way back to my childhood.
Oh no, it was just a post someone shared that covered all the old trends, food, toys, tv shows, etc. I had Facebook back in 2010 but not earlier than that.
How old are you? Were you a child in the 80s? I am 30 so I grew up during the 90s.
Oh so only a few years older than me. I love the feeling of nostalgia though. I pretty much live for it.
I hate bullies. Playground or politics, I find them intolerable.
Good for you! Did you find other ways to interact with kids on better terms?
I expected the new incredibles to be pretty bad but to my pleasure it came out good.
Oh I can't imagine. I don't think I would pay more than a quarter to see that movie.
My parents keep taking my money
They need it for other stuff. I never get a chance to save any of it.
So when adults don't clean up after themselves in a business environment -- what is that?! Why do they think a "mommy" will come along to clean up after them?!

LOL! Okay, y'all are a sitcom. I have to ask what flavor. (And yes, I side with your girlfriend. If for no other reason: ANTS. You do NOT want ants marching into your bed toward any potentially sensitive regions. Okuuurrrrrr?)
The hardest time in my life was when my best friend died on Christmas of 2007.
She fell off of a roof. She fell asleep and when she got up, she slipped.
It has been a long time so I have come to cope with it, but sometimes it's still hard. I named my daughter after her. Her name is Roxie.
It really helped me heal when I was able to do that.
A few years ago, there was a time that I really needed a car. I had to go to school and my husband worked full time.
We had one car we shared but I had a little girl and we were just stuck at the house or got rides. We didn't really have uber and Lydt yet. But someone gave me a car out of the blue!
Thanks me too. It blew me away that people can be so kind.
Have you ever had a surprise birthday party planned for you? I did a few years back.
That's awesome! What a good year to do it. I remember begging my husband to throw me one every year.
Haha! Yes! And what's really funny, is that I almost missed it because I wasn't actually expecting it and almost didn't get back in time! Whoops.
It was raining hard one night and the power shut off
Only lighters. Now we are stocked on candles
One time I studied my butt off for my first psychology exam. It was hard and I studied all night.
I ended up actually getting a 98%!
Haha I always thought that was a funny term too. That's amazing. Psychology is absolutely fascinating.
Do you have any pets?
Yes. We got a cat not too long  ago and he drives me crazy! He's such a night owl and is always banging into stuff.
My son graduated.
Highschool.
One of the hardest times in my life was when I had to leave my husband and daughter when I went through a divorce.
I felt like I had no one. The two people I loved most in life I barely saw and was disconnected from.
It was, but I grew so much from it, and it ended up being the very best thing that could have happened to me.
I know this guy who is so young, yet he owns his own major business. It's really impressive.
He owns his own coffee shop. He started roasting when he was 16 and now he's only 26 but distributes beans across the country.
I feel slightly bad. I think I hurt my mom's feelings last week because she told me about a necklace I got rid of when I was a kid. She's a packrat and I'm really, really not.

I feel like her and my aunt kind of could be on that show. :/ I'm all about less stuff to pick up! lol Eh..it was a necklace she gave me when they found out they were pregnant. It said "Special Sister". I'm probably a jerk..
No, they bought it for me. I think I was going goodwill it and she grabbed it back. lol She said she wants to pass it onto my daughter someday so that's sweet.
Have you ever heard a song on the radio and it just takes you back to a different time? Like an escape?
Yeah, I guess that's fair. It happens all the time to me too. Sometimes makes me wish I was reliving those moments but I don't think I would really want to go back..
lol :) That's true. Life is hard and did seem so much more carefree when I was younger, but I just don't like who I was. I like me now much better :)
I was just thinking about how a few years ago, we lost our cat.
It was the first time he had gotten outside and he didn't come back that night. He was hit by a car. :(
Thank you. I appreciate that.
I'm sorry to hear that. I had a dog die once too.
The flu sure makes it feel like you're dying haha
Agreed, definitely not. I actually work in radiation oncology and see cancer every day at work.
Once I ate a raw oyster because my uncle offered me some and I contracted food poisoning. Things were coming out from both ends, so gross.
Extremely, but it passed after a day or so. Never consume raw shellfish, unless sushi because they properly prepare it
You don't care for sushi that much?
I recently had a prank played on me. My friend pretended to be dead and used ketchup as a prop!
I ended up being very upset at first and then laughed it off!
My boyfriend of five years and I broke up. I don't know what to do with my life.
I don't think so. He wants to join the military since his dad has passed away and I'm not sure if that's the lifestyle I want.
I think we're going to try long distance while I finish up school (3 more years). But it's just scary thinking of it all.
We have dogs and chameleons together, so it's like we're already a little family haha
I recently found out the girl I love may not feel the same way. This makes me sad.
I hope so. Maybe one day, but I am not so sure.
I feel pretty hopeful towards this woman that I really enjoy. I am trying to date her.
I think she has expressed interest in me in the past, but she recently moved, but she is not too far away. I might ask her on a date the next time I am around.
I am very lucky, my friends are so great. What's the best birthday you have had?
Wow, I am impressed! My friends just show me love and buy me tequila aha!
For sure, maybe you need new friends!
I recently had an argument with my sister. It made us both very annoyed.
I recently had a scary experience. I heard gunshots on my street.
Everything turned out fine. I think somebody in the nearby neighborhoods may have been hurt, though.
Do you know the feeling of drinking a mug of hot cocoa with marshmallows on a cold winter's night?
Next time you get a cold front in your area you should try it. It's extremely relaxing and sleep-inducing haha
I live in Louisiana, so it's very rare that I get to enjoy it. I've had it maybe three or four times in my lifetime. It just left a lasting impression.
I love my mom. She does her best to provide for me, even to this day.
I tell her I love her and also send her gifts from time to time. She doesn't live too close to me but I try.
You know, that is tough, but it happens to the best of us. What went wrong?
But you failed the exam? Did you revise?
At least you know for next time eh?
My mom helped me buy a car. She's the best.
She's amazing. Do you love your mom?
I think that the girl of my dreams likes somebody else. I feel very sad about it.
It's tough because she has been out of the country for a month, so I will likely discuss it when she returns.
That sounds tough. What do you do?
That sounds like hard work. I hope you are paid well.
Fair enough. As long as you look after your back
I have only a few more semesters in college. I feel very hopeful about my chances of finishing.
Environmental engineering! I enjoy it, but I wouldn't say it is my passion in life.

When I was a kid, I went to this group with other kids my age, it was in a big gym. There were kids of different ages, and one of the kids (8 years old or so) was picking on the littler kids. Yeah, I was pretty amazed in the moment, he was flat as a board in mid air before he landed flat on his face. I had to watch for a moment in awe, before I realized he was getting up and I was about to get smacked. So, I ran towards where the parents were seated, stopped when I turned the corner, and walked calmly over to my mom, taking a seat on her lap. As a kid, I was SO frightened any time there was a tornado warning. Not sure if it was the Wizard of Oz effect or what -- I just remember being frozen with fear.

That's the thing -- NO! I mean, there were some that were kind of close -- but NOTHING like what so many folks have to deal with. I just remember wanting a basement sooooo badly -- not something that's common where I grew up!

My mom said the best thing once when I was babysitting and a tornado warning went off and I didn't want my own fear to affect the little boy I was with -- she was on the phone and just said "You have big plans for the future, right? Nothing is going to get in the way of that." For some reason, it worked a charm ;-)
I feel so bad when I think back to times that I got angry and yelled at my kids for no real good reason -- just a combination of the day's events and feeling irritated, really.

Yes! THAT I feel good about! Making a point to use it as an opportunity to talk. I've definitely used it when it comes to the way others might act -- emphasizing that it's not about *them*, it's really about the person and where they're at.
I do look at that as a strength, in anyone. Being able to say "I'm sorry" and "I made a mistake."
I was SO excited the first time we were going to make an overseas move! I looked so forward to what I knew would be a life-changing adventure!

I once accidently ran down the battery on my car when I mid-judged how long I could run the radio for without the engine running. It was 5am and I was in the middle of nowhere. I called the first person I could think of who could help and they came with crocodile clips and recharged the battery. I felt so grateful to be on the receiving end of a kind act. I was also embarrassed that I had let that happen and I learned from it!

I once had a long walk home from the railway station with two very heavy bags. It turned out that another person had also missed the last bus and had to walk much of the journey with me as his home was in the same direction as mine. The two bags I had had some expensive DJ equipment but they were VERY heavy so when they guy who had to walk home the same way said he would help by carrying one of the bags I trusted him! He didn't disappoint, he helped me get home earlier and without a bad back; while the kindness of strangers made what a potentially bad night to a reasonably pleasant one - all down to trust!

It's one of those things that in the day time you might expect but this was like 1am so I'm sure he would have wanted to get home as soon as he could but he chose to make his night harder to make my night easier.

I remember being on holiday and trying to find a way to watch an F1 race. I caught the beginning of the race in a bar before it closed and saw that my favourite driver had had a puncture and fallen to last place. My mate asked me what the chances were of him winning from that position? I said 1000 to 1. By the time we were back at the hostel, I learned that he had indeed won the race in what many believe was the greatest single event in the sport's history!

Yeah, for sure! It was one of those nights where we were journey is what's fun rather than what you were aiming to do, if you get me. We went from sports bar to sports bar trying to see who would show the event and by the time we gave up we'd had such a funny night and the race had turned out great!

When I was pregnant with my first born, it was considered a high risk pregnancy. It made me very worried and anxious throughout.

I'm so happy summer classes are officially over and I'll be able to relax for a week!

My sister came to visit from out of state. It was the first time we've seen her in nearly a decade!
Yes she lives on the other side of the country. We had a nice dinner, but my boyfriend is a loud chewer and a sloppy eater. It was quite embarrassing!
I just bought a new dress and I can't wait to wear it this weekend.
I'm going to wear it to a party. Everyone will have their eyes on me!
A few months ago I could barely walk up a flight of stairs without having to catch my breath, but I bit the bullet and have been training.
Wonderful! It's definitely hard work, but I continue on, even on the days I don't want to. Today I discovered I can now comfortably run an uphill mile and I feel very confident!
My boss told me about a potential job opportunity and I've been waiting to hear if it's going to happen
A little bit. I am mostly excited about it though
I was very prepared for my final exam. It was so easy.
If I'm being honest, I made an answer key from the quizzes we took this semester. As they say, work smart, not hard.
My cousin was swinging recklessly on my hammock and ended up breaking it!

I received a phone call the other day from a friend I hadn't heard from in ages.
We reminisced about old times. It was very nice, indeed. It was nice hearing from him, especially during some rough times!
I have a weekend of nothing but relaxation planned for this weekend.
I have some leftover roast in the fridge so I don't even have to leave the house. I'm going to watch a lot of netflix and MAYBE do a little laundry.
I keep having these dreams that I am out in public and somehow my clothes disappear. It's awful.

One of my friends recently bought a house. I really wish I could afford a house.

I ended up staying at home for the holidays
No all my family lives out of state. I didn't feel like traveling, but I just ended up sitting at home and watching lord of the rings in the dark.
I bumped into a friend from middle school. We chatted for a while
Before 9th grade. I moved away that summer. Seeing her brought back a lot of good memories
I had a doctors appointment at 9 am and they kept me waiting for almost 2 hours.

Thank you. I hope that I can move forward and at least learn from these hardships.
I really hate when people can't hold themselves accountable for their own actions and decisions.

I received a very odd message today. It came from a person who I blocked online, but they managed to find a loophole and messaged me by way of an inactive group.

I keep having these really weird nightmares at night.
I'm usually in a big city that I'm familiar with, and roam around in the dream until I get stalked, jumped, and sometimes very hurt.

I had a high risk pregnancy up until a few months ago. I felt the most grateful I'd ever been when my baby turned out healthy.

I just learned my first trick in ice skating, a triple spin twirl kick front flip.
I never thought I would have the balance to perform such a feat. I think I can no qualify for the Olympics.
I just started college again, and while I'm doing great in school, it has lead me to feel very lonely with a lack of social life.

This upcoming semester will be my first time taking 5 classes at once. I'm pretty worried that I may have taken on too much.

I adore my girlfriend. I am getting very serious about not leaving her side.

I recently went to the pool and lost my suit. My trunks were in the water without me!

I feel great right now. I have a new album coming out and it feels liberating to be done!

I can't wait to travel. I am going to Madagascar soon!

My friend who I haven't seen in a long time came to visit. She married a very wealthy man and I was a bit envious

I was at a get together recently and a friend's husband was flirting with me.
