I found my dog's old toy. It brought back memories of when I first got her
I'm sorry to hear that. What kind of dog was she?
After months of job searching, I finally got a good offer
I got a job in statistics
I have a final exam that I've been studying for for days.
I think I will do really well. I feel prepared for it.
I stupidly lent my car to a friend.
He got drunk and took it for a joyride. It didn't end well.
Even though I could've gotten more money at another job, I've stayed with my current employer. It is a good place to work.
I work in public relations. I create campaigns for companies.
I recently did a very successful one for a medical company.
I just had a job interview that went really well. I'm expecting a call pretty soon.
It's a statistical analyst job.
I recently moved to a new city. I left behind some good friends.
That's very true. It'll just take some time.
Last week I was at the grocery store picking up body wash. There were so many to chose from, but I couldn't help but buy my trusted brand that has served me well for so many years.
Yes, why try something new when what you have been using has worked so well.
I have to show some brand loyalty!
I have so much to do today, but it's raining. I'm OK with just staying at home and doing nothing.
It sucks. Maybe it'll be dry this weekend.
My dog I had for five years just passed away. He was hit by a car last night.
It is just so sad to have my loyal companion taken away like that.
His name was Han Solo, I am a huge Star Wars fan. My wife thought it was a dorky name, but I loved it.
I'm ready for hurricane season. I have my kit ready and everything.
South Alabama, near the Gulf.
I have been sick the last week and my wife has made my chicken broth soup every day!
She is such a blessing to me and spoils me so much.
Yeah, I try to treat her the best I can, can't lose someone that amazing.

When I go out to a restaurant, I order gluten free food items.  I have to trust that the cook and server take my request seriously.  If not, my food could be "gluten free" but cross contaminated with foods that aren't and still make me ill.

If it's mild, just stomach pains for a few days.  If I were to say, eat a bun that was supposed to be gluten free and it was full gluten, my joints also inflame.  So you see it can affect more than just my stomach!
Inflammation is the devil.  I'm just glad I found out how to manage it to improve my quality of life.
We ordered 3 diet cokes with dinner the other night, and they all came out a different shade of coloring!
I was concerned they were the wrong drink order, we lined them up and talked to the server and together figured out the syrup bag must be going empty!

While cleaning out our closets, I always find some old item that reminds me how little the girls used to be.  Last time it was a cute pair of jeans in toddler sizing we saved to make "jean purses" out of someday.  My kid is 14 this week!!!
It definitely triggers some emotions!  Then I'm torn between keeping it a little longer or finally purging.
My wife made me pancakes for breakfast. I have a full belly and feel rather happy now.
One of my favorite breakfast foods. She also made some thick sliced bacon. She treats me so well.
For sure, no other woman I would rather have.
How can I complain when she gets up early to make me such a great meal!
I told my brother that I was planning to propose to my best friend, but I hope he keeps it a secret!
He lets things slip once in a while, but this is a pretty big secret so I have confidence in him.
I have a friend who is struggling right now in her business.  I'm trying hard to be there to support and cheer her on.
RIght? Even if I can't directly affect her business, I can help keep her spirits up to weather the storm!
I saw my neighbor bought the car I have always wanted. I wish I was in a a better financial position to buy one.
Subaru Brat, best car ever made. Its like a car and a t ruck all in one.
I know, it would look perfect in front of my double wide mobile home! There is a used one on the corner for $350. But that will take me months to save up.
Yeah, or I could buy more scratch offs at the gas station and hit it big.
I am in the process of potty training my daughter, but when we go somewhere she still wears a diaper. The other day, we were at church and she took her diaper off in the middle of the service.
It was not one of our best moments. Luckily, she was wearing and long dress and I had extra diapers so we could remedy the situation.
I ordered a new toy for my son online for his birthday.
No, not yet. But, I can't wait to! He's going to have so much fun with it.
My husband and I are going on our very first cruise in December. i can't wait!!!
I hope so too. I have wanted to go on a cruise for so long. I'm happy were are able to go this year.
We are going with a few friends, so they booked it and we got a discount because they are returning customers.
My dad called me one day crying out for help. I had to drive over to his house.
He had fallen and bruised his ribs. I had to take him to the hospital.

Even though I'm a christian and I serve God to the best of my abilities, I have been in a rut lately. Last week, during revival, for the first few nights, everyone was praising and participating in worship and just really feeling the Spirit, but I couldn't for whatever reason, and it made me feel bad.

Yes, I prayed about it multiple times, and by the last night, I was able to feel the Spirit move and I was able to praise and worship too. It felt amazing and it carried over into both services on Sunday too.
Thank you. He is all knowing and I'm just so thankful that he cares about me.
Sometimes I wake up at night and eat junk food.
Yeah but I feel bad afterwards. I like to make peanut butter and nutella sandwiches with chocolate chip cookies.
We had a birthday party for my son the other day!
He's 6. It was so much fun to watch him open his presents.

I was the captain of the volley ball team in middle school and high school, so I signed my daughters up to play. since they had an interest in it too. When we got the practice on the first day, the coach said that it was her first year coaching and she asked me if I would help a little.
I was very excite to help. I miss playing very much, so being able to play with my daughters and show of my skills a little was great.
A couple years ago, I was hospitalized and diagnosed with MS.
Yeah, I was blind in my right eye, and my left arm was numb.
My friend has been sick a lot recently and I am worried about her.
Yes.  She has been vomiting and having diarhea a lot
Yes.  It has just happened on and off for months.
I am sitting here chilling out with my cat on my lap.
Yes.  My cat is relaxing and always sleeping
I had a job interview last week
I am not sure yet.  I was very nervous
Next week I think
I spent a weekend at a lake house all by myself.
It was fantastic.  I found it so restful and peaceful just to get away from it all for a while.
I had a get together recently, One of my friends brought someone who couldn't hold their liquor.
Heh, well they projectile vomited all over my carpet, it was gross.
Me and my daughter went to the skate park the other day.
Yeah we did. She can ride up and down the ramps much better than I expected her to.
I've been out of work, and my dads been helping me financially.
No, I am filing for disability. Theres no way I can ever repay him
I had to meet my new physical therapist this week.
They seem ok. I just hate having to meet new doctors.
This is the first time ever that both of my kids have been in school.
Yeah, it's just too quiet lol.
Recently my family had a trip that was very disorganized. Basically drove a long way to hang see my family for a handful of hours.
Same. I wish I had just stayed at home instead of spending all that time on the road.
That is true, I guess there is that to be thankful for.
I had to wait in line at the store the other day for 15 minutes!
Just some random food stuffs. It wouldn't have been so bad but there was only one cashier.
I had to go to my brother in laws funeral last week.
I'm ok. It just hit me hard seeing all those sad people.
I have some friends who are traveling all over Europe this summer
I am!  I would love to go myself.
My and some old friends from college recently got together. It's always great to see those guys again.
Same. And all these guys live in different places now so it's harder and harder to get everyone together.
No. We've had a group text going for several years so we just all decided it had been too long.
My wife bought some new clothes and in classic fashion she lied about how much she actually spent.
I know I know. I just wish she could tell me up front. I get more irritated finding out she lied about it.
Oh, I've tried...
This weekend I saw one woman being kind of mean to another woman of color.
No kidding! I don't see how those kind of people are still around. No. It had already escalated by the time I saw it. We figured it was best to just keep moving.
No. She just thought the other woman wasnt doing her job. Classic sense of entitlement.
I dont get to see my only niece too often. I was supposed to babysit her recently, but it fell through. I was kinda sad I didnt get to see her.
We just dont live super close so it always makes it harder.
The last few weeks have been spent buys school clothes, shoes, and supplies so my girls would be ready to go back to school. There first day was yesterday and it went well.
I'm home with my toddler, so I drop them off and pick them up. The school is exactly 7 minutes away. I'm glad my shopping in advance paid off.
Recently had some test run at the doctors office and it took a few weeks to get the results back.
Yes fortunately everything turned out ok. But it was nerve wracking waiting on the answer.
My husband's grandfather recently passed away, and his three sons are acting very childish and selfish about everything concerning the will.

It really is. The worst part is that they had arguments in front of him, while he was sick, about who should get what. I wish they would have spent that time just loving and comforting him. That's what my husband and I tried to do.
Yes, the whole situation made me mad then and mad now. There is nothing I can do though except pray about it.
Watching my daughters play volley ball with their team makes me remember all the games I played in with my friends.
The memories are awesome and I miss playing.But I wouldn't trade the life I live now to go back,
I am going fishing at my favorite spot tomorrow. I know I am going to catch something!
Blue catfish, they get so huge. I have a secret recipe for stink bait that works well!
Oh I will, fried catfish is so amazing. Especially beer battered!
I am going to play dominos tonight
Well with some locals at the local brewpub
Yes I think I will do well even though I just learned last week how to play!
my family came to visit recently, i always get so nervous about people visiting.
I have to make sure the house is clean and that everything is in order before they arrive, nerve wracking!
I have a birthday coming up. I really hop I get the gift I am asking for.
Thank you, I am hoping for a new camera. It is about time to upgrade.
Thanks, I really enjoy getting out and photographing nature.
My dog go into the trash can and drug it all over the house. I am so mad right now!
I know, it is going to take me all evening to clean up!
He is usually good, but this time his naughtiness got to him.
I am going camping this weekend. I got my tent, sleeping bag and tons of food. I think I have everything I need!
Oh I will, I am ready for whatever the elements throw at me!
It will be a blast, I just love roughing it in the outdoors!
The other night i heard a sound like someone was breaking in my house, i was pretty scared.
No, it turns out the power had went out for a minute and it was the sound of the printer calibrating.
It has been raining a lot lately, I am really trusting the seal on our doors to keep the water out.
I know, it really starts too pool up by our house. It is getting kind of scary!
Yeah, really don't want to deal with a flooded home! Would not be good for my family.
I bought a cake from the store and it ended up tasting terrible.
No, I ended up just suffering through it and eating it.
Yeah, I am afraid to return things. The clerks kind of scare me.
I was nervous about an upcoming job interview recently, I bought a new outfit and got a haircut to make myself feel better.
Yea, it made me feel better about myself and my chances, or maybe i just like spending money
I love chocolate cookies because my grams would always make them for me.
Nothing beats cookies made by grandma. Except for the oatmeal ones. Too healthy haha.
Only if it has raisins to sweeten them up!
I found an old picture of when my oldest daughter started kindergarten 11 years ago.
It is!  In it, she's just standing with a huge smile on her face and a Hello Kitty backpack.
I've been teaching my young daughter to play video games with me, she's such a quick learner.
Minecraft and asphalt racing are two of them, It's amazing to watch a child learn and grow their intelligence.
It broke my heart today when I went to the grocery store and found out that they were out of Dean's French Onion Dip.
I do!  I've loved that particular brand for years - to me it's the best out there.  But I guess there's quite a few people out there besides me that have a real love for it!
Oniony gold!  That's a very apt description!
I'm glad I stuck my job out as long as I did - I finally got offered a promotion today.
It is!  I'll actually be the manager of the entire office, and not just the one section I was in!
I try to.  But I'm glad all the effort is being recognized!
I put in to get a promotion at work, and I should know something either way by tomorrow.
On the one hand, I am but on the other hand I have to relax knowing I did everything I could do and worked as hard as I could.  It's kinda out of my hands now.
I work for a medical supply company.
Last week, they arrested 9 people for animal cruelty at a nearby farm and the place was littered with dead and sick and dying animals that they weren't taking care of.
I have a hard enough time understanding man's inhumanity towards their fellow man, but towards animals who can't do much to defend themselves?  I hope they put those people *under* the jail!
Where I live, they're only now starting to toughen up the animal cruelty laws.  Even so, they lag far behind a lot of other states.
When the England national team made the semi-finals of the World Cup
So good, genuinely had my faith restored in the national team and everyone was having a good time larking about in good weather!
But yeah - school started for the kids today and it was weird how quiet it was once the bus pulled away.

It can.  But we had fun!  Visited lots of relatives, cooked lots of stuff, goofed off and watched more anime than is probably humanly possible...a part of me is enjoying the quiet but on the other hand, I miss having my kids around to do stuff with.
Yep - and I have two left with the older one.  They do grow up so fast!
I had to clean beneath a desk which had not been cleaned in about three years, after there had been some flooding from a manufacturing unit. It was so gross!
Yes indeed, there was even a frog under there! So bizarre!
They arrested 9 people at a nearby farm for animal cruelty and they are already out of jail on bond!

Wow!  It makes me sad how people can be so cruel to animals that don't have the ability to fight back.  The rescue shelters here have been working overtime to get things straightened out at that farm.
Yeah.  But I'm glad at least here we have enough agencies [and people volunteering their time] that hopefully, those animals can find good care and good homes.
And in my opinion, the bond for those people was nowhere near high enough - they should have had to stay in jail!
My son's soccer coach said nice things about his play last year and told me he would do what he could to get him on his team this year as well.
I am, too!  I'm glad he's doing something he loves.  At this point, I'm just waiting on the text to see which team he made it onto.
I'm so glad the kids went back to school today!
Yes!  I can go back to having ice cream for breakfast!  I can watch Law and Order all I want to without the, "Mom, you always watch this!" comment!
How old are they?
Enjoy them now!  Mine are 17, 15, and 10 and too cool for *everything*.  LOL
My two best friends are going on vacation next week and I won't have anyone else at work to goof off with.
On the one hand, I hope so but on the other hand, I'll get bored because there's nothing to break up the day.  Just straight...ugh!  XD
I went for a walk the other day and one of the neighbors dogs was loose, a bit white husky, he was aggressive.
He was growling at me and looked like he wanted to bite me, the neighbor finally came out and called him home. was intense.
The little kitten I rescued last Friday passed away.

She was under my house, crying.  Her mother had apparently abandoned her.  I called my friend who said she was dehydrated and we did what we could, but her motor functions quit and she passed away in her sleep.
And that kitten knew she was loved.  It ended sad, but I take comfort in those things.
My 6 year old tried to play a video game but couldn't understand how the controller worked. A few days later she was playing no problem!
Yea, i was pretty proud of her, especially since things are more complicated now than when i was a kid.
I thought I had paid all my daughter's band fees only to find out that I'm 10 dollars short.
I keep all my receipts - I learned that lesson her 9th grade year.  I just hate having to make the trip over to the high school because it's in the opposite direction of where I do everything else!
I went through a divorce last year, which caught me off guard financially, luckily my mom was able to help with some of the costs.
Yea i'm much better now, thanks to my mom. Attorneys make a killing on these types of things.
When my wife left me it was so quiet in the house! it almost drove me crazy
hah, i hear ya. I just got so used to all the commotion i suppose.
When we were kids, my sister and i once stole a blank check from our mom to order a pizza, we got caught.
My mom noticed the charge and found a the missing check from her checkbook, i'll never forget the look of dissapointment on her face!
Oh yea. grounded for a long time.
I just saw a movie I had been looking forward to and it was terrible
It was the new Jurassic World
My coworker forgot to turn in the paperwork to switch our on call weeks. He ended up costing me $250! I'm so mad!!!
He's such a worm. I can't stand it.
Working from home can be difficult when people won't leave me alone to get work done.
I love my kid but she is non stop with trying to show me the latest my little pony video, gonna pull my hair out.
I have a big date coming up and I can't get these butterfly feelings to go away.
Yeah, I really think she might be the one. I hope I don't screw it up.
Thank you, I am looking forward to taking her to a nice place to eat!
I bit into an apple and found a worm. It was so gross.
Yeah, but not what I want to bite into when I am trying to enjoy my apple.
That is true, I should be thankful for that.
I was hiking in the mountains and walked up on a female bear with her two cubs.
They really startled me, the female did not seem happy to see me.
Yeah, thankfully I was able to get away. It took a while for me to catch my breath.
I got a new dog recently, he is the best. I am so thankful for him!
He is a male australian shepherd. His name is charlie, he is super cute!
Will do! He is super cuddly and loves to follow me around!
There was one piece of pie left in the fridge. Instead of sharing it, I ate it. I kind of feel bad.
It might not be when my wife returns and sees it gone. I look super guilty right now.
I could, I might have to buy her some of her favorite chocolate.
I was at the park today and almost stepped on a rattle snake. I almost jumped out of my skin.
Me too, that would of wrecked my day. It was so close! It haunts my thoughts even now.
It might take me a little while to get over my fear and go back to the park.
For sure, wouldn't want to relive that experience
I just got a bonus from my job. That money came at the perfect time!
It was a really nice bonus too, they were impressed with the quality of work I have done this year.
Now I will have to work even harder and try to earn a larger one next year.
I was going to go to the movies with a bunch of friends. But they all bailed on me and now I have to go alone.
I hope so, but I am really missing them right now. I didn't want to go alone.
It is hard to find reliable friends. No one seems to show up anymore.
I was out photographing butterflies and took the most incredible photo. I am really happy with how it turned out!
The butterfly was yellow. It was a tiger swallowtail. One of my favorites!
I saw my dog try to eat a dirty diaper one time
Yeah, it's nasty. I wouldn't let her lick my face for a while after that.
I was trying to take a nap, but my cat kept on trying to play with my head.
I usually love mine, but not when it is keeping me from sleeping
I just had a job interview and I'm waiting to hear if I got the job.
Me too. I'm feeling pretty nervous about it
I was on a plane ride and we went through some pretty severe turbulence
Yes it was. I was so afraid we'd crash
My cousin and I tricked my butler into thinking he won millions in the lottery. I feel so bad.
Only a few minutes.
Someone came to my door with a gun, asking for money
I didn't have any. He came into the house and stole some stuff
Our cat had to many health problems, so we had to put him down.
I had him for 17 years, he lived a full and happy life, but I was not ready for him to go.
But they make your life so much enjoyable while they are around!
I went to do karaoke with a guy i'm dating and I discovered he's a really talented singer
He's kind of shy about it. He had to get really drunk to perform karaoke
I had to do a research project and present it to my professors to graduate. Thankfully I passed!
I worked many long hours. It was stressful but I'm happy to have done well
My sister has been playing a song I dislike over and over and over
She does it more because she likes it than to bug me. It's going to be stuck in my head for weeks
okay.
That is great! What will you be doing there?
I accidentally slapped someone in the face while I was playing basketball.
No, I think she was just a little shocked by it. I felt so bad.
I let my friend borrow my car. He's an international student and only has a permit.
I was in the car with him. He just wanted to practice driving and he didn't have his own car.
I am at a cross road. I am trying to decide my major in college.
I was thinking about graphic design. Or, I was going to do something practical like Nursing.
I guess you are right. I really like sketching and painting. I can use my creativity side.
I've been trying to save money so that I can help my husband with the Christmas shopping this year.
Well at first I was a little discouraged because I wasn't making that much. Things have picked up recently though, and I feel I will be able to help him a good bit so I'm feeling better about it.
I had planned to take my daughter shopping a few weeks ago. We were all really excited, but the plans fell through.
Yes. We were able to go about a week later, but the closer it got to school starting back I started to stress. Everything is good now though.
I check in with my partner to see if we are okay. I ask him if there is anything that we can work on to make the relationship better.
I don't want to have problems. This is why I check in with him.
When I go out with friends I really have to be tight with my money. Times are really hard for me financially?
I like go out but I have to really make sure that I don't spend too much. I sometimes like to leave a tip if possible.
I find it appalling how my husband's family is acting now that his grandfather has passed away.
Yes, it is. They are all being really selfish and childish. My husband is staying out of it, but I can tell that he is getting fed up with it.
I have to run several errands for my father-in-law today and he wants them done before my mother-in-law get into town, which is at some unspecified time today.
Yeah, I'm ready to get everything done so I can relax. I can't start on the errands until I drop the kids at school though.
I really do miss my mother. She has been dead for about 15 years now.
It is a blessing and curse. When I am having problems I think about what she would say to me.
Yes, it is. I know that time heals.
My children are getting old. They are starting to spread the wings. So, I would have to let go and let them fly.
I have 23, 20, 17 and 14. They are doing stuff that I question but I don't want them to not tell me stuff.

When I was in labor with my third child, they were monitoring me regularly in the hospital. The nurse came in and made a face and then called the doctor. In the 2 minutes it took for him to get to my room, my heart dropped and I started to panic. He told me that the baby's heart rate had dropped and they had to preform an emergency C-section right then.
Yes, everything turned out fine. She is a healthy and happy three year old. It was the scariest day of my life though.
Yes, they do. I ope your boy is all good now.
I finally beat level 150 on the crucible today in my favorite game Grim Dawn.
PC all the way. I've been grinding devotion points all week.
I just found a hello kitty pot in my daughters room filled with water and old flowers.
It's not cute, and she's nine. By old flowers I mean, it's a green, stagnant slush with mold growing on top.
When I enter the bus, I fainted. I think that I got overheated.
Yes I did. It was so hot outside and I did not have much to drink.
I got drunk and embarrassed myself in front of my friends
I fell down, and apparently said some embarrassing things.
My daughter is graduating from college. I cannot wait until she finish.
Yes, I will. She has been under a lot of stress.
Two years ago I got diagnosed with MS.
Its a disease that attacks the nervous system. It was really scary to find out I had it. I just went blind in my right eye one day. Two days and several test later I found out I had MS.
I found out that my daughter is moving out. My youngest one told me so.
I feel really sad because I felt she should have told me.
I let my sister borrow my car. She is a new driver.
Well, nothing. I'm sure that she will be a responsible driver.
I think that I will do good on my test.
It is tonight. I studied really hard.
I heard a song that I hadn't heard in awhile. It reminded me of my high school days
Yes, it had me feeling nostalgic about the times when I was young.
My dad dies when I was 33 years old.
Thank you. I was crushed, and it left me with questions about my own mortality.
My mother fell and injured herself. I wanted help and comfort her in any way possible.
Yes, but bhe bruised her wrist, and had a concussion. I wish that I was there for her when it happened.
I had a nice meal and my favorite beverage after work
It was a skirt steak with avocados. I was very satisfied.
When I started a new job. I was nervous about proving myself all over again.
I did, but I find it hard to trust people. Especially at work.

I am trying to quit drinking soda and I have prayed to God and asked Him to help me. The problem is I am addicted to soda and Its very hard to quit. When I do manage to skip a day, the lack of caffeine causes horrible headaches.
It just makes me feel bad, that no matter how many times I try, I still give in to the temptation.
Yeah, I think that's what I will have to do. Thanks for the advice.
I went on a job interview. I'm anxiously waiting to hear if I got the job.
I still need wait another week.
A drafter.
I just went to clean my kids sink a few minutes ago. I found a bunch of toys in the catch and I am mad.
Yeah, all the toys are out. But, they got some explaining to do after school.
I couldn't sleep last night. I ended up staying up till 2am and eating a large amount of Shepard's pie.
Combination of stress and new meds I think. Maybe I can get back to my old scheduled soon.
I saw my crush talking to another guy.
I was a little upset, but it wasn't my business. I let it go.
When I went to the store the other day, I seen a guy all tweaked out on drugs.
No, but he seemed a little unpredictable, so I used the other door.
Holding each of my children for the first time was amazing.
Yes!! I can't think of any thing else that produces feelings like that.
I forgot about my grandmother's birthday a couple years back. I felt so bad about it!
Absolutely! I called her the next day and made sure to visit her. :)
She did. :) It ended up being a good visit anyway!
I was digging around in some of my old stuff at my dads the other day, and I found all my old paintball gear.
No, just me. But, I am going to go play this weekend at a place up the road. It's been years since I've played.
I went skydiving last summer with my partner. It was so scary!
Absolutely! I've always been scared of heights, but I'm so glad I made myself.
When I was a kid, I had a dog at my grandpa's. He gave it away because it wouldn't hunt.
I was very upset. I was only like nine at the time so I took it really hard.
I tripped and fell in front of some people.
No, only my pride was injured.
I recently dug up a necklace my grandmother gave me when I was young for a birthday. I hadn't seen it in years.
Yeah, she passed more than five years ago and I had forgotten all about it. It brought back so many memories though!
I just won an award for best yard in the neighborhood!
I did, mowed it three times a week and watered it twice a day. All the hard work really paid off.
It is, it really stands out from all the brown grass in my neighbors yards.
I get to go to the park today for a BBQ with friends, it should be so much fun!
We often throw around a frisbee for a little bit, but we never get too intense with any sports.
Me too, there has been a lot of rain lately. It should be fun hanging out with old friends!
I snuck some candy out of my daughter's snack stash. I feel bad because I had been trying to diet.
Otherwise it's been pretty good- I've managed to lose 12 pounds! Just wish I could let the sugar cravings go.
My childhood friend gave me a watch for by birthday a few years ago, I lost it in a move recently. I'm pretty upset by it.
I've actually checked and went through all the boxes too. Here's hoping it turns up one day though!
I let my daughter ride in the road by herself on her skateboard the other day.
She did great. She's pretty good about looking out for cars.
It is so upsetting that my daughter was in a car accident. I am thankful that she was fine but we lost our car because of someone's bad judgment.
It was. They wanted to blame my daughter but it was their fault.
I was feeling really down for a few weeks and my sister knew. She drove hours to come see me and make me feel better!
Yeah it was really sweet of her and made me feel so much better!
I was recently on a long international flight and we hit some really bad turbulence.
I didn't, but I was really nervous for a little while. My wife didn't handle it quite as well.
For sure. And it was a great trip.
I screwed up plans for a date night with my wife. We ended up having to cancel and she was really mad about it.
We did and I made sure to not screw that one up!
Me too. Who knows what would have happened to me if I did it twice.
I was able to go back home to my parents for a few weeks recently. It was wonderful to relax in my childhood home.
They loved having me around again! Our ten year old dog wouldn't leave my side.
I've been thinking about buying some new, softer skateboard wheels.
No, they make rough pavement feel smoother. I think I'll just keep the ones I have for now though. Just have to deal with having a rough ride.
I took my dog I've had for years over to meet one of my husband's sisters the other night.
It did not go well at all! She pooped all over the carpet and she never has accidents at home.
Yeah, I think it might've been too much on her at once. I was pretty embarrassed.
I had to take my daughter to the doctor the other day. She was very sick.
It was just the flu. I got her some medicine, brought her home, and made tomato soup and grilled cheese sandwiches.
So my sister is getting married in a few weeks.
Absolutely! The whole family is flying out, we can barely contain ourselves.
So my friend adopted a new kitten very recently.
Oh, she is absolutely adorable! I'm so envious, I haven't been able to adopt one yet.
Bought a new car a few months back. Couple nights ago we had a big storm roll through. I thought for sure it was going to hail all over my new car.
Nice! We have a garage, but my wife takes up what little room isnt filled with junk with her car. Mine wouldnt fit anyway unless I cleared it out.
I do programming work and I recently had a question I had to run by a co-worker. He is a programming wizard. He easily handled my issue and was using terms and methods I had never even heard of.
That is true. I usually can keep up, but this guy is on another level.
I had a meeting with my bosses the other day to discuss finally getting a promotion.
I've been working there for a couple years now. I'm feeling pretty good about my chances! Haven't heard back yet.
I feel so good about knowing I am going to win the race on Sunday. The race is for my favorite charity. When I win the race I get to give my winnings to my charity of choice.
Yes, it is my local animal shelter. They will be there to cheer me on!
My wife has had a trip in mind ever since I've known her. She recently had a big birthday so I surprised her with the trip. We went and she loved it. It made me happy to see her so happy.
It was just a trip to the west coast. There was a handful of things she's always wanted to see/do. So we did all of them.
Not yet. We try to take one big trip a year if possible. We just got back from that one, so we will start plotting out next year a little later I would imagine.
I live in Florida. When I go home once a year it is a grand occasion.
I grew up in Alabama. It is not far from Florida but still I get so thrill when I can go back to see family and friends.
My sons first day of school was the other day.
Very first. I was so nervous till he got off the bus.
I have a test coming up that I've been studying for weeks for.
It's a Japanese language test for college. I feel pretty good about it though, been going over and over it every night.
I had phone interview for a job. It went very well
Thank you. I wrote down a list of questions and key points beforehand.
I saw an old movie. It reminded me of my younger days.
Yes. It's almost like a time machine. Fond memories.
I lost my job because my company didn't pay rent at our location.
Not very well. It makes me so angry. So I go work out to relieve the stress.
Recently my wife left me home alone with the dog all weekend while she was gone on a girls trip.
I missed her while she was gone. We have a mixed breed rescue pup.
Our computer system at work is goofing up a lot, but the development team just keeps saying there's nothing wrong.
Sometimes. It doesn't stop me from doing things, just slows me down and takes longer than it should to do the things I need to do.
Me too!
Every time my kids go to grandma's they get to eat all kinds of candies, and get new toys.
Yeah they do! Some times I wish I got to go visit grandma's like they do lol.
I was really happy when my nephew was born, Sadly i was informed he had cystic fibrosis, a genetic disease.
He's doing about as well as he can be. Very healthy, but without some new discoveries he will likely have a shortened lifespan.
I bought some cheap stocks hoping that they would go up in price. They didn't.
Not too much. I only put in what I could afford to lose.
I came home yesterday and my dog had pooped all over the floor. He hasnt done that in ages.
Thanks. I dont think so. He has seemed fine otherwise. I've watched him on our security cam today and he seems fine. He is a mutt from a local shelter.
Yeah. I love that goofy animal.  Hope he's ok
I work for a software company. I have been trying to learn a new language for some stuff. I knocked out my first task like a champ.
Well I have the opportunity, but rarely have the time to really devote to it.
Yeah i get that. I work for a startup so things change pretty rapidly around here.
I landed an ollie on my skateboard for the first time in 14 years yesterday.
Yeah it took a lot of practice.
Next week I am off work and going to the beach.
No I am going with my wife and her family. But we all get along great so it should be fun.
Amen. It is much needed. Ready for some sun and a drink with an umbrella.
Not too long ago, I took a trip on a plane. The airline lost my whole suitcase!
The whole vacation! I was so upset! I didn't have anything to wear for the duration.
We usually don't do anything big for birthdays but my wife got me an apple watch this year.
Yeah i really did not see it coming at all.
My boss and I went to lunch and had a personal conversation about some life issues.
We just went to a local taco place. It was a good conversation.
It was more about just some personal life stuff. Not too much really.
I came back from a trip recently, got called in the boss's office and was given a decent sized raise.
Absolutely. I certainly won't say no to that.
Budget is kind of tight lately and I am really afraid my wife's aging car is about to bite the dust.
I may have to if that happens. We are making it now, but if the car goes it will be pretty tough.
It is ok. We are probably too proud to take help anyway. We will make it.
So I recently went through some old boxes and found some of my childhood dolls. It brought back a lot of memories!
Absolutely! I remember having so much fun with them dressing them up. My sister and I would play for hours.
So, i may be in the market for a new laptop or a repair at least, thanks to a little mishap.
My daughter tripped on the cord and it smashed on the ground, not sure if it can be saved. I was pretty angry.
I woke up the other morning, got ready and drove all the way to work. Just to find out it was a holiday and we had the day off.
I know, but the extra day of work was nice. Especially since I wasn't expecting it.
It was wonderful. I ended up being twice as productive since I got up early.
My new job is starting tomorrow. I'm feeling nervous, but really optimistic about it.
It's a job they opened up for graphic design! I'm super excited to get started and learn more from them.
Going to my son's first pee-wee football game tomorrow!
He thinks he does.  All I can think of is a bunch of Tiny Titans in helmets running around like chicks in a barnyard.  *chuckle*
I put in a job application for a new job. I am fairly certain that my credentials are enough to get me the job.
I was, I go in next Tuesday. I am pretty excited for them to give me the job.
Me too, we shall see. Now the waiting begins!
I got a call about job with a good company that is in my line of work.
No, but I have the necessary experience, and I'm optimistic that it will work out.
I went to the petstore with my dog and he had an accident in front of everyone. He had the saddest look on his face.
He did, the clerk walked over, told him it was ok and gave him a treat.
I had a video job interview. That was a new experience.
I'm not sure. It was a little awkward and stressful.
Sure, that's ok. And thank you.
I've been diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis and the pain is horrible. The problem is that the medicine that my doctor wants me to take has side effects worse that the pain.
Maybe, I haven't been back because I can't afford to go right now. I've just been dealing with the pain.
It suck.Hopefully we can both get coverage soon.
My son got picked to be on the soccer team that he was on last year!
He is!  Especially since last year's team won the Opening Day Tournament and then won the Regular Season title!
Yeah!  We had a group of really talented kids, and some very good [and patient] coahes!
The other day, my three year old didn't know I was paying attention to her while she was playing with the dog. I overheard her trying to teach the dog how to count to ten.
Yes, I thought that was pretty good for a three year old. When I asked her about it she said they were playing school. Haha.
I'm very proud of her.
I babysat and worked odd jobs all summer when i was younger to save up and buy a sega dreamcast.
Yep, i've never looked forward to something so much in my life. I still have the dreamcast as well.
I'm gonna need your support here, because I'm going through something a little bit rough, okay?
I'm 29 years old and I woke up to find that I'd wet the bed last night. I'm...not even sure how. I didn't drink a whole lot before bed or anything.
Should I see a therapist or anything? Is this indicative of some deep-seated problem that I'm not aware of?
My Uncle Jebodiah is always looking out for me. He recently told me that he had a special concoction that if I drank it, it would cure my herpes.
Listen, my Uncle Jeb wouldn't do me dirty like that. You may call it """snake oil""" but I call it the miracle cure this world needs. After all, it worked.
My cat was kept overnight at the vets recently. I was so worried!
She's fine now! They found out it was something minor after x-rays. I was so relieved.
My car broke down on a busy highway the other day. There were so many cars zooming past me, it was scary!
My brother had to pick me up. He had to pull up behind me on the curb. It felt dangerous!
Look, can we just be honest with each other for a second? Having ebola shouldn't mean that I have to be grounded and miss out on my chance to walk on the moon during the upcoming lunar missions.

I saw one, and he said if I gave him $25,000 he would clear me for flight, but I don't have that kind of money just lying around. It's a real bummer. Now I just have to do super boring NASA desk work like tracking comets. Lame.
I am obsessive about being ready for anything
I don't know.  I just see stuff in the grocery store and think I like that food and buy it because it is on sale.  Even if I already have it!
My girlfriend's leg was bitten off by a bull shark last summer.

She's fine now. I spent a month in the hospital with her, then was with her every day for three months while she was in rehab. She was out spreading sacrificial lamb's blood in the water on a fishing trip. Gotta love her.
It was swallowed whole, unfortunately. I just hope the shark seasoned it properly. I won't stand for underprepared human thigh meat. Gordon Ramsay wouldn't have it, and neither will I.
I forgot about plans that I had made with my mother over the weekend.
I called her right up and we rescheduled! I felt so bad though.
I was talking to a British friend of mine and trying to explain why our president feels compelled to tweet
They think someone needs to take his phone away
I was looking through the attic and found a box of childhood toys. They brought back so many memories!
It was nice to find them all and think back to those simpler times
The last trip I took to Chicago was by plane.
I had! I love chicago.  The flight is nice and short too, though I wasn't feeling well.
I think my electrolytes were off, I actually fainted on the plane and they made a whole to-do about it.
My university is posting live stream of students moving in and I was reminiscing about when I studied abroad in college
I studied in Venice Italy and travelled all over Europe
I won a storage shed auction last Monday and found my grandmother's old glass eye in a steamer trunk inside of the shed. Really reminded me of her and how much I miss her.
Rita May. She used to mess with me by popping it out and showing me her empty eye socket just to get a laugh while she got drunk off of bourbon. Those were such good times.
I'm pretty excited for the upcoming Halloween season.
Well In September, Universal Studios starts their Halloween Horror Nights events, after dark!  It's so much fun I can't wait to grab tickets.
I was loyal to the same company for 10 years.
Nice. I wasn't rewarded though. They laid me off.
I told a lie to my mother.
I was about school. And I eventually confessed.
I got a job after a long period of unemployment.
Yes. I was very happy to be gainfully employed.
I was in a car accident. Both cars were totaled.
They were running from the police. It was nerve rattling.
So my family surprised me this year with a party for my birthday.
They got me the new shoes I've been wanting. I was so elated and had such a good time!
I had a job interview. The guy really knew his stuff.
Yes, really smart and easy to talk to.
I don't know yet.
Our power went off the other night. We were without it until morning!
Someone crashed into the power line I think. It was so quiet and felt pretty spooky.
I bought a raffle ticket for a charity where I have a 1/500 chance of winning a car
Yes.  They were $100 but they only sell 500 tickets.  And the money raised goes to breast cancer research
jumpfortherose.com
Someone helped me move.
Yes, and I paid them with beer. I was thankful because I had a toe injury.
I bought a powerball ticket last week but did not win
I would have bought a new car and a house perhaps.  But I lost :-(
Yes.  Maybe next time I will win!
I spent Saturday night playing Lord of the Rings Online.
It is good, but I sometimes wonder if I'm trading real life for a fantasy world.
I am so mad that our politicians won't do something to stop Russian hacking
Yes.  The Republicans just don't seem to care about our country any more and I am so mad that Putin owns Trump
My goldfish died.
For 4 years. I'm bummed.
Not yet.
I had an unprofessional job interview.
The receptionist ignored me, and my interviewer was not prepared.
My computer crashed while I was working on a project.
I did. I hadn't saved, and I forgot to set up autosave. It was very frustrating.
My favorite team blew a big lead in the playoffs. It was like drinking sour milk.
I hate when teams choke. It makes me sick.
I woke up this morning and my eye is itchy and my right eyelid is drooping
yeah I am going to see what it seems like tomorrow - not sure if something got in it that scratched it or what
Yeah I will if it does not get better quickly
Me and my family went to see a magic show for the first time today.
I didn't catch his name, but he pulled a rabbit out of his hat. Classic trick, but I'll never forget it!
I have a job interview tomorrow. I'm looking forward to it.
Yes. It seems like a great opportunity.
I scored well on an aptitude test.
I had a few drinks. I felt good.
So today my mother brought over a whole week of meals to help me out.
Yes, she's always helping me out! I am so thankful for her she's an amazing mother.
So I moved away from my parents not too long ago. It's been a big change.
Out of state. I'm by myself now, so it's pretty quiet! I miss them a lot.
My oldest child needed braces but her health insurance wouldn't cover the expense. It was close to 4000 dollars and we did not have that kind of money at the time.
Yes they do. My aunt paid half of the cost for us and didn't has for any of it back because she knew we needed the help.
I was sitting on the couch after a long day taking care of work and all the mommy stuff the other day.
It was! My family was happy and together. Chatting and watching tv. Everything just felt right.
My husband used to work out of town in a different state Sunday through Thursday.

Yeah, he does work hard. Even thought my children were with me and we kept our usual routines, I was miserable when he was gone. I would cry after he left every Sunday. Luckily now, he has a job where he is home everyday by supper time.
We really are, he brings out the best in me.
I didn't have a car to get to and from work, so my parents actually let me just keep theirs for a bit!
Yeah it was so giving of them to leave it to me for so long and helped me a ton!
While driving today I went past my grandma's old house. She passed last year.
Oh for sure. Good feelings, but I also miss her so much.
I went outside to get my paper this morning. Someone had ran over my mailbox!
No, it's completely demolished! I'm feeling pretty annoyed.
My sister is a journalist and she got her first big story published in the paper today!
It is! It's a really big deal and I couldn't be happier for her.
So my partner gave me the biggest surprise this week.
He got us a trip to Hawaii! I couldn't believe it, I am so elated!
I finally went and adopted a cat last month and go way more than I expected!
Well it was only supposed to be her, but we found out she was pregnant! She popped out a whole litter of adorable.
I had to leave town last week and that meant leaving my pets who are my babies. I needed someone who could take care of them properly.
It is very hard! The only one who I'd let do it was my sister and she did an amazing job.
So I finally decided to take my dog for his first dog park visit.
It's hard to tell! He refused to leave my side the entire time and just watched the other dogs play.
Im embarrassed to admit I forgot to pick up my brother from worth the other day after agreeing to
Ha ha, he was a little miffed. He got over it though when I stopped and got him ice cream on the way back though! I felt like such a jerk.
I finally took the plunge and decided to go back to school this year.
I start next week! I was super hesitant at first, but I'm so glad I'm making myself do it.
I was going through some stuff and found a box of jewelry my grandparents had gifted me through the years.
Yeah, it really made me think of them and old times.
I recently had a shop fix my car. They worked so fast!
I was able to go home, but I realize now that I didn't even have to
My husband is going through the process of quitting smoking on top of dealing with drama from his parents. He is having a hard time.
They aren't being supportive at all, but that's not surprising, that don't support him very well in anything. I just wish I could make it better for him, but I can't
I have some great friends. One of them drove me to the airport tomorrow
Yes I am, they are great
We just found out the person working in our accounting department has been stealing money from our company for years.
Yes, it just makes me sick to my stomach. You think you know someone but the whole time they are stealing you blind. I don't get some people
I miss high school. My girlfriend was the best
That's great. College was also fun
I recently bid farewell to a good friend. I miss her
Thank you, that means a lot. I will see her again
I lost my car keys. I'm such a fool!
That's pretty funny, and makes me feel better. This is the first time I've lost my keys so I hope to keep it that way!
I came home the other day and my roommate had a friend over. I've only seen him with a friend over once in my 3.5 years of living here.
Yeah I sure was, he seems to like this one much better than the last one he had over. He couldn't wait for that first guy to leave.

One of my co-worker came and asked me a lot of really weird questions about my supervisor. It seemed suspicious so I pretty much told her I didn't know any of the answers to her questions. I don't think she likes my supervisor.
Yeah I figured it was, so I just played dumb and let my supervisor know. My supervisor has always been good to me.
Man there aren't many people I would give my last couple hundred dollars to, with one notable exception.
My buddy Stefan. He used it to print hundreds of bootleg concert posters. We sold them and netted $2000 a piece!
I finished first in a race. I feel like gold
Yes! It was my first victory. All my hard work is paying off
Some of my friends told me that they had a big surprise for me. They know I hate surprises, but I complied and let the blindfold me and drive me out to the location.
They had decided to pool their money together and get me one big present together. It was a flying lesson at the local airport.
I found an old photo album at my grandma's house that had pictures of me when I was a kid
Yeah, it did. I really miss the 90s. Everything seemed a lot simpler in those days

When I was in middle school, I had a friend come over to ride horses with me. After riding my mother pressured me to get on a horse bareback I wasn't comfortable riding. She made such a big scene that I got on to make her stop.

Yes, the horse took off running and I got thrown into a metal fence. My mother then proceeded to yell and me and make fun of me for trusting her. She told me that I should never trust anyone not even my own parents, it was really embarrassing to get yelled at in from my friend. Afterwards my ribs hurt for 2 months.
My friend really wanted me to go rollerblading with him, but I haven't been rollerblading since I was a little kid. I didn't want to roll into a car.
We went, but it was still pretty terrible because I felt completely uncomfortable and was bent over the whole time ready to catch myself.
My husband is on the road a lot, I hardley ever see him.
Yes, its hard but I try to remember he does it for our family! I have been trying to adapt to enjoying alone time.
I have an interview for a job that I don't feel qualified for
I will try. I'm a pretty anxious person in general so it's hard
I'm moving in a few months to a new state, I'm starting to feel nervous.
To my husband hometown so it'll be new for me but he is excited to be back near family.
I saw a dog get hit by car today on the highway.
It was pretty tramatic, I still see the dog getting hit in my head and the sound. No, I was on my way to work, I couldn't stop :(
I can't even begin to tell you how nervous I was about my first tattoo.
Definitely! I get lightheaded when I see my own blood, and my pain threshold was low at the time. It turned out great though, and now I have several!
I love my husband! He has been so sweet this week!
He knew I had a rough day today so he brought home my favourite wine and Taco Bell! It's the little things :)
It's been a great week!
I got a promotion at work that I wasn't expecting!
Music is a powerful thing. Sometimes it feels like it can transport you to another time and place. You know what I mean?
Who can deny it? My dad passed away 2 years ago. Sometimes I put on his old records and imagine what it would have been like to hang out with him in the 70s.
I was feeling kind of down so I ended up snuggling with a stuffed rabbit I have. It brought back a lot of good old memories.
Awe yeah thanks. He's pretty soft even though he some derpy eye that point in opposite directions. Brings me a lot of comfort and reminds me that someone cares.
My dog got hit by a car.
He did not live. I've never felt so sad before.
Some random guy was in my backyard, I didn't realize before I looked outside that I was missing pants.
Turns out he was the cable guy fixing a wire. Still mad he didn't ask permisson first.
My family is still hasn't recovered from the untimely passing of my father two years ago.
My siblings and I are managing, and have found some peace. My mother is a different story. It was just so sudden and unexpected.
I've got a week off from work. Time to sleep in and binge watch my favorite shows.
I like It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia. I'm rewatching it for the third time
I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity.
That is what I was thinking at the time, but I've been having a really tough time finding a job where I can advance into a higher position. I always seem to get positions with no mobility.
I tripped on some steps in front of a whole bunch of people on my way to class.
It was pretty humiliating. I fell flat on my face.
My boyfriend is sick. He can't eat much so I made some soup for him
I made chicken noodle soup.
I had a meeting last week where I gave a presentation over the wrong documentation and no one said anything until after the meeting.
After I figured out what I did, I sure was. Ate at my cube ever since I don't even want to make eye contact with anyone.
I have a really big meeting next week. I have rehearsed what I am to go over all this past week and plan to practice a little more this weekend.
It's a meeting presenting a new product to the board. Big stuff and big money for the company.
I caught my boyfriend texting his ex
It was definitely a bit flirty. I think he misses being with her
I know I broke up with my ex, but I can't help but feel irritated when he talks about going on dates.
We actually get along really well and are much better friends than a couple. I guess I still just get a littler territorial, i think he does too.
I can't wait to see my final grades. I think I got all A's this semester.
On Monday. I'm going to treat myself if I did well
I was very upset when I found my kitten today.
No, I had to put it down. It ate a poisonous plant. He should not have been outside.
I cried a bit, but kept it together for my little girl because she had let him out.
I enjoy visiting the nursing home on occasion.
Not really, I take my daughter to see them, so many of them have no visitors at all.
She likes to bake, so we take them what she makes :)
She is pretty good for an eleven year old, better than I was.
I had a secret and went to my mother to confide in her, as well as get off my chest. I know she would never betray my secret and can always count on her.
Yes, I sure do! There aren't many people you can feel that way with and I am so grateful!
My son applied to a prestigious college and the wait killed us. I was anxious and nervous waiting to see if he was accepted!
He did! He's in his 3rd year, going to be an Aerospace Engineer, so we are very proud of him.
My sister passed away several years ago. She took her life, and my mother and I found her right after she did it. This was very painful, traumatic and hard for us all.
It didn't really seem to sink in for my mother for awhile, she was in denial. But, it was so hard when it did. I went into a depression for awhile, as she was my only sibling and we were very close.
When my son first started college, I felt so much love and affection, but it was definitely hard to see him go! I was very proud though.
He went to the University of Alabama in Huntsville. It's focused on science, engineering, etc. He's going to be an Aerospace Engineer. It's great to see him go for his dreams!
We went on vacation a few weeks ago and went to the beach, It was so relaxing and great. I really enjoyed the time with my family.
That's great! I'm sure you earned it, just like we do. It's so good to get some time away from the hustle and bustle of life!
I am looking forward to next week! My husband has been out of town on business for several weeks and comes home next weekend!
I am going to cook a special meal and see if he wants to go out, just us two. I know he will like that.
My husband has been out of town a few weeks for work but is coming back next weekend. I have a surprise night planned for just us. I am optimistic and sure he will really enjoy it.
Thanks! We've been married almost 23 years but I try to keep things fun and spend time together.
My son went back to college recently and it had me feeling a bit nostalgic. I could just picture him starting Kindergarten and it seemed not so long ago!
Yes, very. But, time sure has flown by with him growing up. I can just see his little blonde head when he was 5 and just starting school!
I was promoted to a Team Leader and I felt very secure I could do well at the job. I had years of experience and was ready for a leadership role.
Yes, thank you! I had worked very hard through the years, and I felt that I earned it, and would do well at it.
There was an incident where one of my back neighbors called my young son a name and made fun of him. I was so mad, beyond angry!

Yes, and she had two children of her own, similar in age. Her son also weighed more than mine! She did it because my son rode his bike through the corner of her yard as rode around the circle, that made her mad! Can you believe that??
Last week my granddaughter started school for the first time. I worried about her the entire day.
It turns out she loves and and I was a mess for 8 hours for nothing.
I always try and plan everything in advance to bring everything we need when we go on vacation. We recently went on our honeymoon and I didn't do very well this time. Ugh!
I forgot everything. I guess I was so excited about the wedding, I totally failed at packing this time. Oh well, it was still fun.
One day I was visiting a friend and her boyfriend came up and kissed me, while I was waiting for my friend to return from another room! It was sneaky and repulsed me!

I didn't....only because of her situation. She had custody of her very ill and handicapped infant grandson, she wasn't working so depended on him financially and she was very much in love with him. She already suspected he was with other women, and stayed.....
The other night I was home alone and all of a sudden I heard someone knocking at the door really loud and they wouldn't stop. I was so scared.
No, I ignored them and they finally went away. I was just about to call the police before they left though. I hope that doesn't happen again.
I was trying to ignore the fact that my 50th birthday was coming up but my family decided to throw me a surprise party.
It was so much fun and such a happy night. I'm trying to embrace my age now and not ignore it any more
A few weeks ago, my husband and I had a big argument. I said some pretty hurtful things, and wished I hadn't. I felt very bad and disappointed in myself afterwards.
Yes, that's true. I tend to be a bit more verbal on my end and say things I regret later.
One night when my kids and I came home, I saw a shadow in my hallway as I came in the back door. I was so scared and was afraid someone had broken in my home.
Yes, and I live out in the country so I wouldn't get a quick response time from emergency vehicles. But, luckily, it turned out to be my shadow!

There was a day that I was a bit short on cash on hand and I didn't give money to a homeless man. I usually always do, as I feel it's my part to help those in need, as I am blessed. I felt very bad that I didn't that day.
Well, homeless people aren't common in my area, so that's why I felt a bit bad about it.
When my children were born, it was a rejoicing time for me. I can't think of a time I felt more happiness.
Yes, I have two children and I feel so blessed to have them. I lucked out and got a boy and girl, both healthy, smart and wonderful.
I used to work in a place where all my colleagues had different believes to myself. I wanted to stay true to what I believed in, so had to walk away from conversations on many occasions.
Just that all people should be given an equal chance in life and that no one type of person is better than another, just because of their religion or skin color, or where they come from.

They believed that people of their religion where better than everyone else and were going to heaven, while the rest of us are left at the gate! That's one of their beliefs anyway. I don't agree with that, but chose to keep my mouth shut!
I recently bought a new car after not driving for several years and I was really scared to drive it, especially on the highway.
Just a Honda Civic. People drive crazy around here. I don't want to have another car accident like the last one.
I recently joined a group to help me lose weight. I have so much respect and admire everyone in that group so much.
It has really helped to have their support. I am so grateful for them
A few years ago I applied for US citizenship. To succeed you have to pass a Civics test. I was so terribly nervous!
I passed! Turns out you only had to answer three questions correctly. But they have 50 to choose from so you have to study the lot!
Thank you. My poor husband had to sit every single night and test me. He's American and he didn't think he could pass!
I found some old Christmas cards the other day and had a lovely time reading them and reminiscing about the people who sent them.
It was so nice. I'm terrible about throwing cards out. I feel, if someone's taken the time to write, I should preserve it. Does that sound silly?
That's very true. My Dad kept everything too. When he passed we had quite a task sorting through things. I think my brother's still at it!
I believe you are right! My family are going to go nuts when they see what they've got to deal with, lol.
When I was entering the store it was really slippery.
It had been raining, so I ran across the parking lot in to the store. I slid about 3 feet.
I was fine, just felt like every one was looking at me.
I am feeling a bit guilty about keeping a secret for my friend.
I don't want to out her to her husband, usually the only thing that happens is they drop the friend.
Thanks, I am just going to avoid them until it plays iteself out.
I feel kind of blue today, they announced the parts for the annual play.
I did, and it is a good one, just not the one that I wanted. I didn't want the lead or anything.
It is, my friend got it, or I wouldn't think about it so much. Thanks for the kind words though.
I'm teaching my daughter how to drive, and so far, so good!
She is!  At first, though, she was very nervous.  I told her we could start off slow - her dad lives 1 mile from me down a quiet road, so we started driving back and forth between the two houses.
Hopefully by the first of the year.  We've worked up to driving to the dollar store 5 miles away.  She's still a little nervous but she's getting better and more confident the more we practice.
I do what I can where I can.  Can't wait for our hard work to pay off and she gets her license!
My house is a mess and I've got people coming over later on this evening.
I'm going to try to.  If worst comes to worse, I'll just toss everything in my back bedroom, shiny up the floors and hope for the best!  *chuckle*
My brother and I recently had to sell a house and he dealt with everything. I'm so lucky to have a brother I can rely on and who I know won't try and con me.
We did and he was so precise with who got what and made sure he sent me my share quickly. He's such a neat brother in so many regards. I always know he'll be there for anyone who needs help.
We weren't always close. When we were kids we were always fighting. It wasn't until we got older that we got closer. We're best of friends now.
Don't be! There are many, many types of relationships and I don't think ours is necessarily typical. It's just the way it is :)

My son was in advance placement and honors during high school. He went to a prestigious college after, going for as an Aerospace Engineer. He never ceases to astonish me with his intelligence and admire me with how hard he works to pursue his dreams.
I am quite proud, thank you! I also have a teenage daughter that is very smart and an amazing artist, (which I don't know where she gets that talent). They really impress me with amazing they are!
Going out today to learn a new route for my job and I'm hoping that I don't get lost.
I got the assignment yesterday, and I told myself that I'd go drive around it today and tomorrow.  My boss is supposed to ride along with me the first week, and then after that I'll be on my own.
I was over here in the US when my Grandma passed in Scotland. I was so upset - nobody could get hold of me to tell me and her funeral was over before I knew about it.
Only for funerals, unfortunately. Both my parents have since died. Unpleasant fact of life, I'm afraid.
Yes I was. I didn't come to the US until I was in my 30s. Didn't expect my Grandma to pass the minute I got here, but she was 96, so it shouldn't have been such a surprise!
She was as fit as a flea too. She tripped and broke her hip and got a bad infection in the hospital. That's what she died of!
I just bought an Xbox! I've never owned a gaming console before
I am! I bought Halo and am ready to ride.
My father passed away 2 years ago, but my mother lives in my neighborhood now. I'm so thankful she lives close by and still here with us. She's such a wonderful mother.
I'm sorry to hear that, I know it's so hard to lose a parent. I think we take them for granted when we are younger, but I am blessed she's still here.
I am as happy as a clam right now. My neighbors are away for the weekend!
The live upstairs and constantly thump around, screeching into their cellphones. And then there's the video games...
Oh I am, believe me I am. The world seems like a calm, serene place where everything is just right!
My friend from across the continent came over yesterday! I was so happy about it

I was out for a walk one night in a suburb of Boston when we heard the cries of a young animal. It was a baby kitten, with no collar, in a window well.

I felt a need to help when the baby bird was by itself

Waiting to see if I would graduate was pretty unnerving

I forgot my mother-in-law's birthday this year and can't look her in the eye!
